image.altText: Man speaking in front of microphones to a group of people

props.synopsis: Cabinet approved the use of public funds for then-Tasmanian cabinet minister Michael Ferguson's personal defamation action against an individual in 2020. Right-to-information documents show it came to $300,000.

title.children: Tasmanians billed $300,000 for Michael Ferguson's legal fees, RTI shows

image.altText: close up of ceramic fragment found on Bruny Island. Shows person in uniform wearing hat.

props.synopsis: When Amanda Richardson stumbled upon a seemingly old pottery fragment near a walking track on Bruny Island in Tasmania, its history caused huge speculation online.

title.children: 'Little face' ceramic fragment found on island sparks online debate

image.altText: Grove bus stop 2025-02-25 11:02:00

props.synopsis: Locals warn they've seen "many near misses" between schoolkids and cars at a notorious bus stop along Tasmania's Huon Highway that was the site of an accident this week.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Boy critically injured at highway bus stop known for 'near misses'

image.altText: A woman with dark shoulder-length hair wears a pink checkered shirt, sitting on a couch in glowy window light.

props.synopsis: Australia's housing industry and regulators aren't keeping up with the desire to build smaller, denser housing in cities around the country, including regional centres, experts say.

title.children: Australia is in the middle of a culture shift to smaller homes, experts say

image.altText: Map of Robbins Island with dots for wind farms and orange-bellied parrots.

props.synopsis: A critically endangered species of parrot migrates through the Tasmanian site where a wind farm is planned with data proving it, a bird expert says — contradicting previous claims made by the company. That should be enough to stop the proposal, the ecologist says.

title.children: 'Clear' evidence critically endangered birds use site of proposed wind farm, expert says

image.altText: An unidentified doctor holds a pile of red, yellow and white complementary medicine pills in their outstretched hands.

props.synopsis: Almost 10 years after being directed to regulate unregistered health practitioners to better protect the public, some parts of Australia still haven't got around to it.

title.children: Calls for greater regulation as people running 'wellness centres out of their living room'

image.altText: A woman with a 'Keep Kunanyi wild' T-shirt sits in front of a waterfall.

props.synopsis: Pakana woman Theresa Sainty shares her favourite place in the foothills of Kunanyi/Mt Wellington and how the palawa kani language was brought back.

title.children: Reviving Aboriginal language from journals and the community

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black jacket and hat gesturing with his hands as Donald Trump sits at a desk next to him before a US flag

props.synopsis: About 21 civil service employees from the US government department of efficiency have resigned saying they refuse to use their technical expertise to "dismantle critical public services."

title.children: Dozens quit Elon Musk's DOGE warning of significant security risks

image.altText: The Matildas celebrate a goal against Chinese Taipei.

props.synopsis: Australian Olympians Rosie Malone and Libby Trickett say they hope calling out the sexist comments made by radio host Marty Sheargold against the Matilda's will be a catalyst for change.

title.children: 'Do better': Aussie sport stars call for change after radio host's Matildas rant

image.altText: A picture of a young girl set in front of a grid of drawings of adult.

props.synopsis: The parents of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs, who died after her insulin was withdrawn, have been sentenced to 14 years in jail for her manslaughter.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs's parents sentenced to 14 years jail for manslaughter

image.altText: An adult lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Private health insurance premiums will rise by an average of 3.73 per cent from April, after multiple rounds of negotiations between the federal government and insurers.

title.children: Here's how much your private health insurance is going up by

image.altText: A bearded man holds his hand to his forehead

props.synopsis: If agreed, the deal would mean the US would receive preferential access to Ukraine's critical minerals deposits, in exchange for continued American support.

title.children: Trump, Zelenskyy say no US security guarantee in drafted Ukraine minerals deal

image.altText: A close up of Peter Dutton, in front of a flag.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has blamed "dirt sheets" from the prime minister's office for media reports raising questions about bank shares he bought during the global financial crisis and detailing his property transactions.

title.children: Dutton defends his $30 million in property transactions saying he's 'successful in business'

image.altText: Podcaster Abbie Chatfield interviews Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Podcast interviews were a key part of the US presidential campaign and now Australia's federal election is looming, Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are turning to audio to reach voters.

title.children: 'If you think it's biased, it is biased': Albanese and Dutton turn to podcasts ahead of election

image.altText: A woman at a campsite.

props.synopsis: City of Moreton Bay chief executive Scott Waters says the change will benefit the region's homeless population.

title.children: Council declares all homeless camping illegal on public land

image.altText: Marty Sheargold wearing headphones and speaking on air for Triple M.

props.synopsis: Marty Sheargold and Triple M have "mutually agreed to part ways", after the radio host made offensive comments about the Matildas on air.

title.children: Marty Sheargold, Triple M part ways following Matildas furore

image.altText: A headshot of Drake, dressed in black on-stage.

props.synopsis: The hip hop star has made an unexpected early exit with a string of Australian and New Zealand shows remaining.

title.children: Drake has cancelled his remaining Australian shows

image.altText: Two grey jet planes sit on a tarmac against a grey sky preparing to take-off

props.synopsis: Taiwan's defence ministry condemned China's activity as dangerous and sent sea, air and land forces in response to "monitor, alert and respond appropriately".

title.children: Chinese 'live-fire' drills prompts Taiwan to send its military

image.altText: Woolworths store logo that says Woolworths and has its green 'w' logo next to it.

props.synopsis: Supermarket giant Woolworths disappoints investors with its half-year result, which shows the hit from strike action and customers increasingly cross-shopping to secure value.

title.children: 'Customers not responding': Woolworths reduce products to save on costs

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: External signage for Genea IVF

props.synopsis: An international ransomware group has published a sample of highly confidential patient information from major Australian IVF provider Genea, after a cyber attack forced the company to shut down its systems for days.

title.children: 'I'm so angry': Patient fury after latest update on Genea cyber breach

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: A court has heard Troy Cordingley had been searching for his daughter for hours with her mother and brother when he found her buried in the sand.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley's father tells court he fell to his knees when he found her buried on beach

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair wearing a red top.

props.synopsis: Although billionaire Elon Musk and his associates have been championing DOGE's cuts, the White House has insisted that Mr Musk was a senior adviser and is not in charge.

title.children: What we know about Amy Gleason the acting administrator of DOGE

image.altText: An old image of Heather Winchester sitting on the couch holding her baby grandson.

props.synopsis: The religious organisation's rules should not be used in NSW, says a coroner at an inquest into the death of a 75-year-old follower who refused a blood transfusion and died when surgery went wrong.

title.children: Coroner condemns Jehovah's Witness blood rule after patient's death

image.altText: Police at scene

props.synopsis: Police have launched a murder investigation after a 27-year-old woman died following a shooting at Toowoomba, west of Brisbane.

title.children: Police launch murder probe after 27yo woman dies following shooting

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wearing all black with his left palm on his chest alongside Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and red tie

props.synopsis: The deal would see the US jointly develop Ukraine's mineral wealth, with revenues going to a newly-created fund that would be "joint for Ukraine and America", according to a senior Ukrainian source.

title.children: Ukraine 'agrees to terms of US critical minerals deal'

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: The review into Netstrata began last year after the ABC found the company had been regularly using its wholly owned insurance arm to charge apartment owners exorbitant insurance brokerage fees, and had been taking kickbacks from its contractors and suppliers.

title.children: 'Disturbing' report finds top strata firm potentially broke the law

image.altText: A magpie lies on a blanket.

props.synopsis: WA wildlife carers say they are yet to fully understand a disease that is mostly impacting and killing magpies but other bird species as well.

title.children: Mystery illness paralysing magpies concerns carers as cases increase

image.altText: A close-up shot of a woman with grey hearing wearing a polka dots

props.synopsis: The number of cases of the soil-borne infection is at an all-time high in northern Queensland, and a survivor says people need to take it seriously.

title.children: Melioidosis survivor recalls 'absolutely cruel' infection as cases rise

image.altText: A woman stares out the window in a high rise building.

props.synopsis: Lured by fake jobs on social media platforms, women are trafficked to scam compounds and forced into "sexual slavery". Experts are calling for intervention and support to help victims reintegrate when they return home.

title.children: Women forced into 'sexual slavery' after lured to scam compounds

image.altText: An election poster nailed to a fence. It bears the image of a smiling man in a hat.

props.synopsis: Two rivals vying for the New South Wales federal seat of Calare are claiming they have been victims of vandalism as police investigate an alleged assault on a lawyer.

title.children: Lawyer allegedly assaulted amid battle for Nationals stronghold

image.altText: Former One Nation Adviser Sean Black

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's party has quietly rehired convicted sex offender Sean Black a second time — this time as campaign director.

title.children: Convicted rapist runs One Nation election campaign

image.altText: Chief Justice Michael Grant wearing in his judge attire sitting at a court bench.

props.synopsis: In an extraordinary public statement, Chief Justice Michael Grant said a teenage boy the NT chief minister accused of having "beat a two-month-old baby" was not in fact alleged to have harmed the child.

title.children: NT chief justice responds to 'outrage' over court's youth bail decision

image.altText: A mocked-up illustration shows a train moving past a station labelled 'Airport 1'.

props.synopsis: The Prime Minster Anthony Albanese has announced a cash splash for Victorian rail and roads, including new platforms at Sunshine station, a boost to Melton rail and funding to fix potholes in outer Melbourne.

title.children: Albanese makes $2 billion promise for Melbourne Airport rail link

image.altText: crashing waves with grey storm clouds overhead

props.synopsis: There is a high probability Cyclone Alfred, currently around 1,000 kilometres offshore, will cross one of the most highly populated stretches of the Australian coast next week.

title.children: New weather modelling predicts Cyclone Alfred's arrival
